        Get a normalized artifact name. Artifact names must not contain path characters '/' and '\'. This function will replace any path character with '-'.
        Parameters:
        name - to normalize
        Returns:
        the normalized name

      • isArtifactCommentEditable

        public boolean isArtifactCommentEditable(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                UserDto user,
                                ArtifactDto artifactComment)
        Returns whether the artifact comment or attachment is editable and deletable by the user. By definition, a comment or attachment is editable only if both isArtifactVersionEditable(UserDto, ArtifactRevision) and this method returns true.

        Important: as it name suggests, do NOT use this method with documents or wiki pages, only with comments and artifacts.

      • handleAsUpdate

        protected boolean handleAsUpdate(UserDto user,
                     ArtifactDto oldArtifact,
                     ArtifactDto newArtifact)
        Check if the removed oldArtifact should be re-used/restored upon creating a new artifact of the same type and with the same name at the location of the old artifact.
        Parameters:
        user - is the user that wants to create a new artifact where a similar artifact is already in trash
        oldArtifact - is the removed artifact in trash
        newArtifact - is the simlar new artifact to create
        Returns:
        true if the new artifact should be treated as an update of the old artifact, false otherwise
        Since:
        CB-7.1

      • getAllArtifactsToCopyOrMove

        public java.util.List<com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.util.ArtifactRevision<ArtifactDto>> getAllArtifactsToCopyOrMove(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                                                                                UserDto user,
                                                                                                                java.util.Collection<?> artifacts,
                                                                                                                java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> mapping,
                                                                                                                ProjectDto targetProject,
                                                                                                                ArtifactDto targetParent,
                                                                                                                boolean isCopy,
                                                                                                                java.util.Map<NamedDto,ArtifactDto> existingArtifacts)
                                                                                                                  throws AccessRightsException,
                                                                                                                         ArtifactNameConflictException
        Returns all artifacts (incl. descendants) which we attend to copy or move and also checks whether any of them already exist in the target directory and is not writable.
        Parameters:
        request - is optional request information
        user - is the user that makes the copy/move
        artifacts - are the artifacts to copy/move
        targetProject - is the target project, or null for project independent artifacts
        targetParent - is the target parent, or null for top-level artifacts
        isCopy - true if the operation is copy, false if the operation is move
        existingArtifacts - is a Map where to store existing artifacts that will be overwritten (can be null): key = typeId plus path relative to targetDir, value = ArtifactDto
        Returns:
        a List with all artifacts to copy/move: directories first, then files
        Throws:
        AccessRightsException
        ArtifactNameConflictException

      • copy

        public java.util.Map<ArtifactDto,ArtifactDto> copy(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                          UserDto user,
                                          java.util.Collection<?> artifacts,
                                          ArtifactDto destination,
                                          boolean overwrite,
                                          java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> mapping)
                                            throws AccessRightsException,
                                                   ArtifactNameConflictException
        Copy the specified artifacts to a new destination project/directory. It works also if the source artifacts and destination are in different projects.
        Parameters:
        user - is the user that makes the copy
        request - is the request to copy
        artifacts - are the artifacts to copy
        destination - is the target parent/project, or null for project independent top-level artifacts
        mapping - is the optional category of documents to copy plus mapping of source document type to document type of copy
        overwrite - whether to overwrite existing artifacts with the same type and name, or not
        Returns:
        a Map with origin Artifact mapped to artifact copy
        Throws:
        AccessRightsException - if the user does not have read/write permissions for all artifacts to copy or overwrite
        ArtifactNameConflictException - if artifacts with same name and type exist at destination that cannot be overwritten

      • copy

        public java.util.Map<ArtifactDto,ArtifactDto> copy(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                          UserDto user,
                                          java.util.Collection<?> artifacts,
                                          ArtifactDto destination,
                                          boolean overwrite,
                                          java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> mapping,
                                          java.util.Map<? extends ArtifactDto,? extends ArtifactDto> redirect)
                                            throws AccessRightsException,
                                                   ArtifactNameConflictException
        Copy the specified artifacts to a new destination project/directory. It works also if the source artifacts and destination are in different projects.
        Parameters:
        user - is the user that makes the copy
        request - is the request to copy
        artifacts - are the artifacts to copy
        destination - is the target parent/project, or null for project independent top-level artifacts
        mapping - is the optional category of documents to copy plus mapping of source document type to document type of copy
        redirect - is a Map of additional artifact references to redirect from old artifact (key) to new artifact (value)
        overwrite - whether to overwrite existing artifacts with the same type and name, or not
        Returns:
        a Map with origin Artifact mapped to artifact copy
        Throws:
        AccessRightsException - if the user does not have read/write permissions for all artifacts to copy or overwrite
        ArtifactNameConflictException - if artifacts with same name and type exist at destination that cannot be overwritten

      • move

        public java.util.Map<ArtifactDto,ArtifactDto> move(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                          UserDto user,
                                          java.util.Collection<?> artifacts,
                                          ArtifactDto destination,
                                          boolean overwrite,
                                          java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> mapping)
                                            throws AccessRightsException,
                                                   ArtifactNameConflictException
        This method moves artifacts to a new destination. Works correct for moving artifacts between different projects.
        Parameters:
        user - is the user that makes the move
        artifacts - are the artifacts to move
        destination - is the target parent/project, or null for project independent top-level artifacts
        mapping - is the optional category of the artifacts to move and mapping of source artifact type to destination artifact type
        overwrite - whether to overwrite existing artifacts with the same type and name, or not
        Returns:
        a Map with original Artifact mapped to moved artifact, or null
        Throws:
        AccessRightsException - if the user does not have read/write permissions for all artifacts to copy or overwrite
        ArtifactNameConflictException - if artifacts with same name and type exist at destination that cannot be overwritten

                    ProjectDto project)
        Map all notification subscriptions of the (moved) artifacts to the destination project. Role subscriptions are mapped to target role, or removed if no such role exists in target project. User subscriptions are removed, if the user is not a member in the target role.

        projectId - to find top-level artifacts if parent is null
        parent - is the reference to the parent artifact (directory)
        onlyTypes - is a List of the document types to look for, or null to look for documents of any type
        excludeNames - is a List of document names to exclude from the search, or null to not exclude any names
        Returns:
        a List of the historic child artifact revisions of the specified parent artifact in the specified baseline

      • findChildRevisions

        public com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.dao.PaginatedDtoList<com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.util.ArtifactRevision<ArtifactDto>> findChildRevisions(UserDto user,
                                                                                                                                                java.lang.Integer projectId,
                                                                                                                                                java.lang.Object parent,
                                                                                                                                                java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> onlyTypes,
                                                                                                                                                java.util.List<java.lang.String> excludeNames,
                                                                                                                                                com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.dao.PaginatedDtoList<?> page)
        Find the historic child artifact revisions of the specified type of the specified parent in the specified baseline
        Parameters:
        user - that requests the artifacts
        projectId - to find top-level artifacts if parent is null
        parent - is the reference to the parent artifact (directory)
        onlyTypes - is a List of the document types to look for, or null to look for documents of any type
        excludeNames - is a List of document names to exclude from the search, or null to not exclude any names
        page - is the requested child artifact page, or null to get the first page
        Returns:
        the requested page of non-deleted child artifacts

                java.lang.Integer oldParentId)

      • canLock

        public boolean canLock(UserDto user,
              java.lang.Integer artifactId)
        Check if the specified user can lock the specified artifact
        Parameters:
        user - who wants to lock the artifact (required)
        artifactId - is the Id of the artifact to lock (required)
        Returns:
        true if user can lock the artifact, otherwise false

      • lock

        public boolean lock(UserDto user,
           java.lang.Integer artifactId,
           long time,
           java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Lock the specified artifact for exclusive use by the specified user (for the specified time period). A persistent/infinite lock (time << 0) has precedence over a temporary/transient lock. You can always replace a temporary lock with a persistent (infinite) lock, but not vice versa.
        Parameters:
        user - who wants to lock the artifact (required)
        artifactId - is the Id of the artifact to lock (required)
        time - is the time how long to lock the artifact (<< 0 means infinite)
        unit - is the unit of the time, defaults to @TimeUnit.SECONDS if not specified
        Returns:
        true if artifact was locked for user, false if artifact could not be locked

      • lock

        public boolean lock(UserDto user,
           java.lang.Integer artifactId,
           boolean hard)
        Lock the specified artifact for exclusive use by the specified user (for the specified time period). You can always replace a temporary lock with a persistent (infinite) lock, but not vice versa.
        Parameters:
        user - who wants to lock the artifact (required)
        artifactId - is the Id of the artifact to lock (required)
        hard - true to create a permanent lock or false to create a temporary lock with a default expiration of 30 min
        Returns:
        true if artifact was locked for user, false if artifact could not be locked

        user - who asks for the lock (can be null)

      • unlock

        public boolean unlock(UserDto user,
             java.lang.Integer artifactId,
             boolean hard)
        Unlock the specified artifact. Note: A project admin can always unlock artifacts in his project.
        Parameters:
        user - who wants to unlock the artifact (required)
        artifactId - is the Id of the artifact to unlock (required)
        hard - whether to remove also the permanent lock (true) or only the transient/temporary lock (false)
        Returns:
        true if artifact was unlocked, otherwise false

      • findByPattern

        public com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.dao.PaginatedDtoList<ArtifactDto> findByPattern(UserDto user,
                                                                                 java.lang.Integer projectId,
                                                                                 java.lang.Integer parentId,
                                                                                 java.lang.String searchPattern,
                                                                                 java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> onlyTypes,
                                                                                 java.util.List<java.lang.String> excludeNames,
                                                                                 java.lang.Boolean deleted,
                                                                                 com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.dao.PaginatedDtoList<?> page)
        Search artifacts (in the specified project and/or folder) by name pattern and return the specified result page
        Parameters:
        user - that executes the search
        projectId - of the project, or null to search project independent artifacts
        parentId - directory of the artifacts, or null to search in all directories
        searchPattern - for the artifact name
        onlyTypes - is a List of the document types to look for, or null to look for documents of any type
        excludeNames - is a List of document names to exclude from the search, or null to not exclude any names
        deleted - whether to search only artifacts with this deleted status, or null to ignore deleted flag
        page - of the results to return, or null to get the first page
        Returns:
        the requested page or search results

      • checkPermission

        public void checkPermission(UserDto user,
                   ArtifactDto artifact,
                   int operation)
                     throws AccessRightsException
        Check if the specified user has permission for the specified operation on the specified artifact
        Parameters:
        user - whose permission to check
        artifact - to create, update or delete
        operation - must be one of AbstractDao.INSERT, AbstractDao.UPDATE or AbstractDao.DELETE
        Throws:
        AccessRightsException - if the user has no permission for the specified operation on the specified artifact
        Since:
        CB-7.0

      • findOrCreateDirectories

        public java.util.List<ArtifactDto> findOrCreateDirectories(UserDto user,
                                                  java.util.List<java.lang.String> path,
                                                  ProjectDto project,
                                                  ArtifactDto parent,
                                                  com.google.common.base.Function<ArtifactDto,java.lang.Void> setupCallback,
                                                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
                                                    throws ArtifactNameConflictException,
                                                           AccessRightsException,
                                                           ChangeVetoedException
        Find or create the directories to a path
        Parameters:
        user -
        path - The path to the bottom directory
        project -
        parent - Optional parent to start searching at, allows you to create subdirectories too
        setupCallback - Optional function called back when creating a new directory, can change properties of the new directory before that is created
        request -
        Returns:
        The list of directories from top to down, some might be newly created too
        Throws:
        ArtifactNameConflictException
        AccessRightsException
        ChangeVetoedException
